thread.title: Green Bay twins Andi & Alex advance on "The Voice"
thread.title_full: Green Bay twins Andi & Alex advance on "The Voice"

title: Green Bay twins Andi & Alex advance on "The Voice"
text:
Green Bay twins Andi & Alex advance on "The Voice" By Piet Levy of the Journal Sentinel Oct. 20, 2015 6:08 a.m. 
Much like their hometown Green Bay Packers , "The Voice" contestants Andi and Alex Peot just keep on winning. 
The 23-year-old identical twin sisters, performing together as Andi & Alex, managed to convince all four celebrity judges to turn their chairs around during their blind audition on the NBC singing show on Sept. 29. 
Despite aggressive campaiging from Blake Shelton, Pharrell Williams and Gwen Stefani, the twins opted to join coach Adam Levine's team. And Monday night, during the show's battle rounds, Levine had their back, opting to keep the twins on his team following a duet performance of The Calling's "Wherever You Will Go" against another one of his competitors, Chance Peña. 
"Andi and Alex have the most ethereal brilliance to their performance style," Levine said after the performance. "That's why I had to go with them." 
Don't feel bad for Peña though, who was stolen by Shelton after Levine eliminated him from his team. Although Shelton too had glowing words for Andi & Alex. "That was magical," he said. "There's something about sibling harmony that's like nothing else." 
"Andi and Alex, what you do when you sing is nothing short of magic," Williams echoed. And Stefani added, "The harmonies are candy in my ear." 
The twins will next perform on "The Voice" during the knockout rounds. A date has yet to be announced. 
You can watch their Monday night battle with Peña below, and below that, their blind audition.
